name: Country Suites By Carlson, Lake Norman

reviews.text: I've stayed at several Country Inns & Suites (in multiple states) since October of 2007, and I have to say that this was one of THE BEST trips for me. I recently had to travel to New Jersey to take care of my 97 year old mother-in-law, and I stayed in both Roanoke, VA (North bound) and Lake Norman, NC (South bound) on the way to and from Georgia to New Jersey (and back). Both the staff and the accommodations in both cities were beyond my expectations. The staff at both locations provided me with all kinds of information and directions to different restaurants and nearby attractions, and made sure that my stay was excellent. Kudos to everyone in both locations, and I look forward to staying with you again!!!!!!
reviews.title: More than I expected

reviews.text: We live in Huntersville. We stayed at the Country Suites last night because our air conditioner was shut down for the evening for repairs. The accommodations could not have been better. The suites are well furnished and attractive. The staff was professional and cheerful. The continental breakfast was much better than average.
reviews.title: Excellent Charlotte Area Accommodations

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located at Exit 25 on I-77, about ten miles north of Charlotte. There are several full service restaurants within the complex that guests can easily walk to, including a Chili's and a Melting Pot.
reviews.title: Very Accomidating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We always stay at Country Inns because they are one of the few hotels that can accommodate six people in one room. In addition, they have in door pools, which means you can have fun even in the winter and when the weather is rainy. But to this specific trip and hotel. We were traveling and our van was running hot to the point that we had to get it repaired. We contacted them before we even got to the hotel and they were able to direct us to a couple of shops next to the hotel. Due to the time we got in, none of the repair shops were open and I had to take the van to the repair shop first thing in the morning. As expected, the repairs took much longer than expected. The staff at Country Suites was extremely accommodating and allowed us to stay up until 4 PM in the room until they said they would have to charge us a 1/2 day or we could pay for a full day and spend one more night. In addition, they offered to shuttle me back to the auto repair shop when the van was fixed. It was very nice to be treated kindly when we were in a bad situation and really did not want to pay for an additional nights stay. The room was clean and nice. Nothing was broken and no funny smells. A+++ in my book.
reviews.title: Perfect Night! (Romace Package)

reviews.text: I purchased the Romance Package through this Hotel. It included a $50 Dinner voucher to The Melting Pot (just steps away from the hotel), a dozen handmade chocolates from a local candy store, and a nice bottle of champagne.Then of course one nights stay in a king jacuzzi suite. This was an anniversary gift to my husband and one of the best anniversaries we have EVER had!! The staff here was very friendly and had great communication with reserving our dinner reservations as soon as I booked. The hotel was very beautiful and clean. I had one of the best nights sleep I have had in a long time due to the wonderful king bed and soft plush pillows. We WILL stay here again. I highly recommend the Romance Package! It was money well spent!
reviews.title: Welcome Place to Stay

reviews.text: Stayed for three nights at the Country Suites in early December. It is a typical suburban hotel by the highway surrounded by soulless suburban sprawl -- Target, Chili's, blah, blah, blah...
reviews.title: Unexceptional, but comfortable enough hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unlike many suite hotels today, the suites are proper two-room suites with a door dividing the bedroom and living area. Unfortunately, the kitchenette is rather undersupplied and does not include any dishes, silverware, etc. Beds are comfortable, but pillows are a bit flat.
reviews.title: A Great Night's Sleep

reviews.text: Housekeeping could do a better job of being thorough -- our room had a couple of socks in the bedroom and an empty shampoo bottle in the bathroom. The room wasn't dirty, however.
reviews.title: Family friendly, comfortable, clean, and close to restaurants

reviews.text: Breakfast was a bit disappointing -- only hot food comes in the form of make-your-own waffles and microwaveable eggs and breakfast sandwiches. Could stand to feel a bit fresher.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel North of Charlotte

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this hotel feels tired and worn -- it could use a renovation quite soon. Nevertheless, the staff was very, very friendly, especially Karen in charge of housekeeping, all of the housekeepers and breakfast staff members themselves, as well as the front desk staff.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Family and business bring us to Huntersville regularly and during the last few years we've made this hotel our designated "home away from home". Even five-night stays here are a pleasure.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, roomy, reasonably priced w/ amenities, really great staff & walkable dining options

reviews.text: The reasonably priced king suite provides more space than most hotels in this price range.  The separate bedroom and living areas (w/ kitchenette; 2 flat screen TVs) provide a space more like an apt than a hotel room. Uptown urban chic it's not, but it meets our expectations of clean, comfortable (including bed), roomy, convenient and reasonably priced with amenities and really great staff. (We feel "excellent" is a delicate balance of all of the above.)
reviews.title: Business/family get away!

reviews.text: Located in a landscaped enclave near Chili's, Longhorn Steakhouse and Melting Pot, a very short walk makes it convenient (& safe) to wind down and enjoy a couple of drinks with dinner.
reviews.title: Still Nice, but Showing Its Age

reviews.text: And, if you're overnighting en route, it's great to check in here at 4 pm, relax, enjoy the amenities and not have to get back in your vehicle to go to dinner.  Conveniently located at I-77 (exit 25), it's an easy exit and re-entry.
reviews.title: Good value but uncomfortable beds

reviews.text: Also, located only a short mile from Birkdale Village shopping & dining (for your extended stays).
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: We attended a wedding last weekend staying at the Country Suites of Lake Norman. The staff was wonderful, extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was really clean like no one else had stayed there before us and very comfortable. I recommend this hotel to all. Thank you to the staff for a great stay. Oh and the breakfast selection was really good from fresh fruit to waffles with fresh pecans.
reviews.title: The Place to Stay

reviews.text: This hotel has some of the friendliest employees I have ever met. They are very quick to offer help and suggestions for the surrounding location. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The free breakfast was also a pleasant surprise. They have a lot of items to choose from and are quick to keep things stocked and clean. We had a very pleasant stay here and will probably make this our hotel of choice while visiting family members in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent, friendly staff. Clean, comfortable hotel.

reviews.text: We had the most awesome family weekend. The hotel very clean. Staff was so pleasant and they couldn't do enough for you to make your stay enjoyable. Jane Blackwell, District Director of Sales assisted us in the morning with the printing of our boarding passes as we couldn't get the printer in the business office to cooperate! The complimentary breakfast is very adequate-many choices to fill your belly! Very convenient to shopping. Fresh cookies and coffee almost always available. I would highly recommend staying.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Country Inn and Suites Lake Norman this past weekend visiting with family looking for a home in the area. They chose the hotel, having stayed here before. I think we were there on a tough weekend for the hotel, which brings this review and our overall experience down.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable Near Lake Norman

reviews.text: We pulled up and found a full parking lot and saw dozens of people in red shirts spilling out of the lobby and into the area outside the entrance. it was packed. Apparently there was a large family reunion taking place there that weekend. We had kids running and bumping into us and it was overall very loud in the lobby. The noise continued, as did the cars parked taking up multiple spots and the general feeling that this reunion had taken up the entire hotel. Luckily we did have a suite which insulated us from the noise a bit. To Carlson's credit, they did respond immediately to my survey and comments so I am happy about that. Once the group left on our last day it was very quiet and we didn't have to fight crowds for breakfast and I assume that is what the hotel is like most days. I just feel that they should deal with groups better. I had my wedding guests at an upscale NY hotel and we had very strict rules in the contract regarding groups and that our group could not disturb other guests.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Good Location but check prices through other sites

aka: Country Suites By Carlson, Lake Norman Hotel Huntersville
description: We are proud to offer bountiful amenities designed to ensure a stress-free and enjoyable stay. Refuel with our complimentary hot breakfast buffet, relax in our indoor heated pool and jacuzzi, reconnect on our complimentary high speed wireless internet, and rest well in a one bedroom suite featuring your choice of a plush king size bed or two queen size beds. Our suites feature additional space in the living room which is separated by a door that shuts. In your suite you will find a refrigerator, microwave and (2) plasma flat screen TVs. Above all, you will enjoy true southern hospitality through our staff’s willingness to ensure your stay is remarkable. Enjoy all our region has to offer, with easy access to Charlotte, Birkdale Shopping and Golf Course, Huntersville Aquatic Center, Bradford Park, Historic Latta Plantation, and beautiful Lake Norman. For a comfortable and rewarding stay, we invite you to reserve your group at the Country Suites Lake Norman.
